alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued March 05 at 2:34AM CST until March 05 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: .OVERVIEW...Periodic freezing rain will continue through this morning. Ice will accrue on untreated surfaces, making travel hazardous to dangerous... potentially impossible in some areas. Travel is highly discouraged along and north of I-94 this morning. ...ICE STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Significant icing. Ice accumulations of one tenth to two tenths of an inch across the southern half of Clark County and around a quarter inch in Taylor County and the northern half of Clark County. * WHERE...Clark and Taylor Counties. * WHEN...Until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage possible. Hazardous to dangerous travel is expected.
info.instruction: Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. For the latest road conditions, check 511ia.org in Iowa, 511mn.org in Minnesota, and 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.
